description: A heavily fortified tower within the Ryugu Palace grounds where Princess Shirahoshi has been confined for 10 years to protect her from Vander Decken IX's attacks. The tower has thick walls designed to withstand weapon impacts.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Discovers Hard-Shell Tower
keyEvents.description: Luffy accidentally stumbles into Hard-Shell Tower while searching for food and meets Princess Shirahoshi for the first time.
keyEvents.significance: The location where Luffy and Shirahoshi first meet, beginning their friendship.

keyEvents.title: Vander Decken's Axe Crashes Through Tower
keyEvents.description: A giant axe thrown by Vander Decken crashes through the tower wall, targeting Shirahoshi, before being stopped by Luffy.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates that even the heavily fortified tower cannot fully protect Shirahoshi from Decken's attacks.

keyEvents.title: Shirahoshi Reveals 10 Years of Imprisonment
keyEvents.description: Shirahoshi tells Luffy that she has been locked in this tower for 10 years, unable to leave due to Vander Decken's constant threats.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals the tower's purpose as both protection and prison for the princess.

statusHistory.reason: Tower is operational and serving as Shirahoshi's protective prison

description: The royal palace of Fish-Man Island, home to King Neptune and his family. The palace is a grand underwater structure where the Ryugu Kingdom is governed.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Accused of Conspiracy
keyEvents.description: The Minister of the Left formally accuses the Straw Hat Pirates of conspiracy to destroy Fish-Man Island and orders their detention in the palace dungeons.
keyEvents.significance: Creates tension between the Straw Hats and the Ryugu Kingdom authorities.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Captured at the Palace
keyEvents.description: Zoro is captured by palace guards and detained, though he restrains himself from fighting back.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the escalating conflict between the Straw Hats and palace authorities.

statusHistory.reason: Palace is operational as seat of Ryugu Kingdom government

description: A massive ancient ship of tremendous size resting on the ocean floor near Fish-Man Island. Noah is a legendary vessel with connections to the island's ancient history and the promise between Fish-Man Island and Joy Boy.

keyEvents.title: Vander Decken Arrives at Noah
keyEvents.description: Vander Decken IX arrives at the massive ship Noah on the sea floor to meet with Hody Jones.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces Noah as a key location and meeting place for the antagonists.

keyEvents.title: Alliance Formed at Noah
keyEvents.description: Hody Jones and Vander Decken IX form their sinister alliance aboard Noah, plotting the destruction of Fish-Man Island.
keyEvents.significance: Noah becomes the staging ground for the antagonists' plans to destroy the Ryugu Kingdom.

statusHistory.reason: Ancient ship resting on the sea floor
